text: I knew it! I always suspected that half of my remote coworkers were too good to be true.
Only half? Your team must have a high concentration of human talent then.
Or maybe the AI chatbots are just getting better at pretending to be human.
I can't believe this study! But it does explain why my teammates are so responsive at 3 am.
So that's why they never get my jokes during video calls. I thought I just needed to work on my comedic timing.
Maybe it's time to create a chatbot that understands humor, so we can have more laughs in the office chat.
Not a bad idea! I could use some AI-generated humor during late-night coding sessions.
What if we're all just chatbots who think they're remote workers? 🤔
That's an existential crisis I wasn't prepared for today. Thanks, pythonista_guru.
Better start questioning our reality, folks. Are we in a simulation as well? 🕶️
Great, now I have to worry about my job AND my existence. Just what I needed on a Monday.
I wonder if I could delegate some of my work to a chatbot without my boss noticing...
If 75% of remote workers are chatbots, it's quite possible your boss is one too. 🤖
I'll create a CAPTCHA test for my next Zoom meeting. That should confirm things!
"Please select all the squares with traffic lights to join the meeting" 😂
We might just be one step away from "Prove you're human to keep your job" tests.
If my future AI coworker can finish my tasks AND laugh at my cat memes, I'd be thrilled!
As long as they don't start sending cat memes back, I'm good with that.
